ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class offers excellent preparation to people who are interested in engaging on a high level with current research in developmental neuroscience. It has helped me to make connections between my own work and study and major questions that clinical psychologists and neuroscientists are asking today. I feel much more confident now that, if I sit down to read a new paper in clinical psychology, I will be able to situate the findings meaningfully in the broader conversations in the field. Additionally, the course has given me a new and highly applicable vocabulary for the neurobiology of stress responses and common mental health disorders.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Dr. Gee is an excellent conversation facilitator, and additionally, invited guest speakers many weeks of the term, like Dr. Laurel Joy Gabard-Durnam and Dr. Rosemarie Perry, to share on their current works in the field. Students complete this course with the sense that they have participated in important dialogues (including controversial or unresolved questions) about the field. One of the best things about this course, in fact, was being able to learn about research that is ongoing, conflicted, and surprising that is, to get an insider view of the science unfolding.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. I think this is an excellent opportunity to participate in fascinating conversations with creative minds (instructors and students alike) about clinical psychology and neuroscience. The environment of the class, too, is approachable and welcoming to people from a wide range of backgrounds.
